title: The Ripley SL is Made in California
content:
The all-new Ibis Cycles Ripley SL is made in California, in Ibis’ 100% solar-powered factory. It’s made from handcrafted carbon, featuring some clever engineering details, and is an example of Ibis’ drive and obsessive passion in creating bikes…

Ibis Ripley SL Quick Hits

  • $4499 frame
  • Completes start at $6249
  • 117 mm rear DW-Link, 130 mm front travel
  • Made in California carbon chassis
  • Lifetime warranty
  • 26 oz bottle size small, 2 x 22 oz all other sizes
  • 2.4″ tire clearance
  • 29er wheels
  • 66° head angle
  • Variable seat angle

Ripley SL Geo

Every rider deserves the same great ride feel, no matter their height or proportions. Ibis uses size-specific seat tube angles and dialed DW-Link suspension kinematics to bring incredible balance and speed to all size riders. Even chainstay length and bottom bracket height are tailored to each frame size. Planted firmly in all-rounder, downcountry, or XC race geometry, the Ripley SL utilizes a 74.25 through 75.25º seat tube angle depending on size, a constant 66º head angle, variable BB height, and up to 440 mm in chainstay length on size XL.

Sungrown

Each frame is sungrown in California (Made in the USA) in Ibis’ state-of-the-art solar-powered facilities. The manufacturer builds each Ripley SL frame, one by one, giving the brand utmost control, enabling it to hit remarkable frame strength, stiffness, and weight targets for this frame. Size medium weighs five pounds.
